result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine L Chamberlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Counts 1 & 4

1:30 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Roeth has received a copy of the revocation packet, with one corrections, and no additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victm witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA Christenson.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 1

9 months county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
Court orders the court costs of $478 and restitution of $250.00 be reduced to civil judgments.

Count 4

9 months county jail, concurrent to count 1 but consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
Court orders the court costs of $443 be reduced to a civil judgment.  

Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 1:41 p.m.
By Atty Joey Roeth
FTP Hearing November 21, 2016, for $443.00; CANCELLED
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
from Department of Corrections dated October 6, 2016 - requests the JOC be amended
for Return/Destruction of Exhibits

Defendant's Exhibits 1-4

10:17 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - sentencing and restitution hearing to proceed.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by Pamela D.  Statement by DA Christenson regarding restitution.  

Pamela Davis sworn, direct by DA Christenson, goes over restitution requested.  Cross exam by Atty Haase.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  Re-cross by Atty Haase.  Atty Haase moves all exhibits into evidence.  No objection by DA Christenson.  Court accepts exhibits 1,2,3 & 4.  Argument by DA Christenson.  Argument by Atty Haase.  Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing Argument by Atty Haase.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

Ct 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.
Ct 4 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

Count 2

-30 days county jail with huber.  Out of county travel.  Out of county service.  To commence within 60 days.  
-Court costs - 60 days to pay or payment plan.


CONDITIONS (count 1 & 4):

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be in any bars or taverns.
-NO Contact with Pam D or her residence.
-Random UA's
-Restitution - $250.00

Court adjourned at 10:32 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on July 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Jeffrey Haase dated June 13, 2016 (FAX ONLY)
Sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from Atty Jeff Haase requesting the sentencing hearing scheduled for 06/06 be rescheduled due to a conflict. (FAX COPY)
Sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

12:09 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - requests a plea hearing be held today and then the sentencing and restitution hearing at another time.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to 2 counts of Theft and possession of controlled substance.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1,2 & 4 and strikes the repeaters and orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. 

Court sets for Sentencing Hearing and Restitution Hearing on May 2, 2016 at 3:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 12:18 p.m.

9:09 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeffrey Haase.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Haase - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.  

State files an information with the court.  Attorney and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing in approximately 60 days.

9:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Pamela D. or her residence.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary hearing in 20 days - December 2, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.
